title: datalad asks for password even when IdentityFile is configured in SSH config
body:
#### What is the problem?
I've set up my ssh config like this for a RIA remote:
```
Host ria-server
  User dataladdb
  IdentityFile ~/.ssh/dataladdb.pub
  Hostname my-host.intranet.lan
  ProxyCommand ssh -X -q -W %h:%p my-proxy
```
Running `datalad create-sibling-ria -s server ria+ssh://ria-server:/home/dataladdb/ria-store` results in:

```
[INFO   ] create siblings 'server' and 'server-storage' ... 
[INFO   ] Fetching updates for Dataset(/home/admin/dddb/dataset-test1) 
dataladdb@my-host.intranet.lan's password: 
```

So it ignores the configured public key, whereas `ssh ria-server` works as it should.

EDIT: same problem when trying `datalad clone` on some `ria+ssh`-located dataset.

Then it is even worse - I get asked for password *twice*, and for the second it changes the configured user name, like in #5475 

#### What steps will reproduce the problem?

Create a user on the remote and a keypair, get it's public key and set it as the identity file. 

Create a new dataset, then try creating a sibling with e.g. `create-sibling-ria ria+ssh://ria-server:/home/dataladdb/ria-store` in a RIA store addressed by the remote.

#### What version of DataLad are you using (run `datalad --version`)? On what operating system (consider running `datalad wtf`)?
0.14.7 on Arch Linux
